content: This acquisition was completed, we have been working very closely with JAFRAâs talented management team to identify and execute synergies and efficiencies in the short-term, and to replicate Betterwareâs business model supported by our strategic pillars of product innovation, technology, and business intelligence, which will enhance JAFRAâs growth prospects and profitability in the mid-and long-term. In Betterware, we were not immune to the strengths, but our business proved its resiliency and now Q2 2022 average weekly sales are 100% higher than pre-pandemic comparable period, namely Q2 2019, representing a 26% CAGR and according to the market study, we expanded our market share to 7.7% in 2021, up from 5% in 2020, and 2.6% in 2017. And EBITDA margin contracted by 484 basis points to almost 24%, explained by lower revenues and lower operating leverage as our SG&A expenses represented 34.9% of net revenues for this quarter compared to 28.8% in the second quarter of 2021, despite a contraction of 25% in absolute terms in operating expenses. Our consolidated EBITDA margin was 18.4%, 1,039 basis points lower than the second quarter of 2021 explained mainly by JAFRAâs lower margin profile, which opens an opportunity for us to improve its cost structure and increase the companyâs profitability. Consolidated gross margin expanded 991 basis points to 67.1% compared to 57.1% in the first half of 2021, explained partially by JAFRAâs higher gross margin and partially an expansion in Betterwareâs gross margin of 348 basis points year-on-year. Consolidated net income decreased 53% year-on-year due to lower operating leverage and higher interest expenses related to the debt used for the acquisition of JAFRA and consolidated adjusting net income, which excludes non-cash expense of MXN 71.1 million related to the unrealized loss in mark-to-market valuation of financial derivative instruments decreased 37% year-on-year.
